title: A pleasant new dialogue: or, The discourse between the serving-man and the husband-man The lofty pride must bated bee, and praise must goe in right degree. To the tune of, I have for all good wives a song.
author: Crimsal, Richard.
publisher: for F. Coules dwelling in the Old Baily,
notes: Signed at the end: R. C., i.e. Richard Crimsal.
Verse - "As I went through the meddowes greene,".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
